greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the sum of the k-th powers of the descent set statistics for permutations of [n]; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..25, flattened
R. Ehrenborg and A. Happ, On the powers of the descent set statistic, arXiv:1709.00778 [math.CO], 2017.
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; expand(`if`(u+o=0, 1,
A:= (n, k)-> (p-> add(coeff(p, x, i)^k, i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0$2)):
mathematica: b[u_, o_, t_] := b[u, o, t] = Expand[If[u + o == 0, 1,
A[n_, k_] := Function[p, Sum[Coefficient[p, x, i]^k, {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, 0, 0]];
Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 20 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 09 2020
